Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with TNBC December of 2014. 1 Dr staged it at 2 and another at 3.Chemotheropy began almost immediately. 18 weeks. 1 every Tuesday. Each session lasted 5 too 7 hours.  It took much longer than 18 weeks because I had to stop several times. Complications! Then I  had a bilateral mastectomy and skin expanders were placed for reconstruction. Then I started  26 radiation treatments. I was told that I am in remission. I have not been myself since.  I am tired. My fingers and toes contort without warning and is very painful.  My teeth are breaking off. I am off balance  and confused easily. My memory is very bad. Is anyone else having these problems? One question I can't get ananswer too is, Has my lifespan been shortened due to the aggressive treatment. Also what does remmisoin really meen?  If anyone has any input please do.  Thanks to all
Posts.Title: 18 weeks of Prison?
